reviews.sentence: Convenient for WOMAD and city. We had a 5 night booking and were disappointed with a room overlooking a multi storey car park. Our request to change rooms was obliged and greatly appreciated to a room with a bit of a view and a patio. The buffet breakfasts were great too. Handy to everything Anything city related System for an iPod Greater selection of TV channels.

Fantastic Staff Bar One. Welcoming staff. Great location. Good facilities. Well decorated aesthetically pleasing. There was an extremely rude female receptionist with short blonde hair and glasses who could work on her customer service skills. Valet parking is pricey.

Comfy night away. Room was clean and tidy beds comfy. View was not that great a multi story car park. but then we were not there for the view. We did lose TV reception but there was quite a bad storm friday evening. Also could not work out the fridge settings and I think I may have accidentally turned it off. Concierge and staff were only too helpful.

Parking is not for free. Good servise nice Hotel. The hotel parking is very expensive. We got a room which we thought was a good price however the parking that we paid at the hotel made up the difference so in the end the room was not a good deal. The parking stations near buy are just as bad so its best to find a hotel with free parking. Despite of this disappointment the service was good and our room was nice but it faced a car park. Watch out for discounted rooms.

Truly Consistent Hotel. Whenever travelling to Adelaide for work this is the hotel of choice been going since it was the Crowne PlazaAlways find the staff friendly rooms clean. and it is consistent which so many hotels just ain’t. Always enjoy a beer at the bar there very laid back and enjoyable. Downside. Parking it ’s valet or nothing which is a shame. the only saving grace there is that it ’s not extortionate pricing like some hotels charge.

Service and room quality as expected from the Pullman. Stayed from 2 5 Jan with friend for holiday. We had Room 812 comfy king bed with spacious shower room and lush Amenities. Not much of a view facing a multi level car park. Finding a parking spot on streets was a nightmare with a maximum of 2 hour parking. Pullman offered 38 valet parking but I ’d rather spend that else where. Overall it was 810 for me. It would be my choice of accommodation if without a car.

Good. Had city appointments and we were able to check in early and leave our car and luggage at the hotel until lunch time after we checked out. Car parking quite expensive compared to other city hotels. Room service trays left in hall ways.

not the Pullman standard expected. I asked for the Deluxe PARK room and got what I think was the BRONX view. After discussing with reception I was moved to 1203 which was better but still alas not really a park view hey. Really not what I paid for and misleading when booking. Then the 2nd day I had trouble changing the toilet roll so left the fresh new roll on top of the dispenser expecting the cleaners to help change it. Nope came back after the room was serviced with the toilet roll still sitting on top of the dispenser not in it. If you pride yourself as a PULLMAN hotel why would you leave the roll like that. The next day the room was not even serviced. We were out from 250 onwards. Came back late to no fresh linen or towels. Lastly waiting to check out for about 5 minutes i noticed the check in counter became free and he took the people behind me. WHY. I was there a long time before them. I am not pleased with the experience. Will go somewhere else next year.

Over all a bit disappointing. Nice Hotel in the city but not really suited for people driving as car parking was an issue. Were told to go to next driveway from hotel and go left and left and I went into a Wilson car park in Bent Street. I was not told not to go in there and I realised the car park voucher was not for Wilson however I did not know it was for the car park in Rundle Street. Am not not used to car parks and do not know the difference between a Wilson one or any other. Should have been explained a bit better as when the voucher did not work we took a Wilson ticket and explained to hotel reception and they said it was the wrong one. We went back paid the 12 hour fee and moved to the correct car park. Also 1 in and out per day was a bit of a hassle and the front of the hotel is always full with hire cars.

Stellar property. One of the better hotels I ’ve stayed at in Australia. A few issues with WiFi and error in charges but all were quickly corrected. Friendly reception restaurant and bar staff. Parking is ofsite but not a huge inconvenience. Close to East Rndle street eateries Rubdle street mall shopping and the rest of Adelaide.
Fantastic welcome on check and helpful information regarding parking from front office staff.

Very nice hotel. Nice rooms. Check in and check out excellent. Valet parking went smoothly. Only complaint is the very limited a la carte menu in the Salt Restaurant too bad if you do not want or can not eat seafood.

Extremely comfortable short break in Adelaide. The hotel is very conveniently located to many Adelaide attractions such as the Art Gallery Botanic Gardens Wine Institute and State Library. There are many good restaurants and bars in the surrounding streets. The car park although a short walk from the hotel is convenient and good value. The room was comfortable and the staff friendly. The late checkout was much appreciated.

I was here for 11 nights. had the seafood buffet excellent lunch at the bar room service all great meals executive lounge had a good assortment of canapes and other delights and Boman provided excellent service in the executive lounge. Valet parking is perfect when coming and going. Great gym and pool too. Will always stay here while in Adelaide.

One of the best hotels in Australia. This hotel is fabulous for many reasons but mainly for the people who work there. Llewelyn has such great vision for the hotel and his team obviously share this vision. Being greeted by Ric and his team at concierge is like being welcomed home they are so friendly and professional. I have never seen a better concierge service. As I ate breakfast in the restaurant I watched them run back and forth greeting guests with umbrellas and parking cars. They are incredible. Also Diego the most awesome chef prepared special meals for my son who is vegan. He comes out of the kitchen to talk to guests which I think is really special. Adrian is a great people person and he and Diego are an awesome team. I would love to mention all the awesome staff members who made our stay so pleasant but there s so many housekeeping coffee shop reception and even the nice people who test the pool water. Thanks for a great stay.

Very good customer service at all the area I stayed for one night I was not happy with my room facing car park On arrival to my room. mini fridge was turned off and not working. I had to call the front desk to report it Since I was coming back week after I called the hotel and make sure my next stay be A different room and it was So happy. I sM coming back next month aAgain and hoping for room with balcony.

Very friendly staff. Arriving late tired and hungry on a Friday night after a delayed interstate flight the staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful. Our check in was seamles our car whisked away to be parked luggage offloaded and taken to our rom and an excellent suggestion for dinner with location instructions within easy walking distance. could not have asked for more.

Comfortable with a park between hotel and road nice secure parking good food shopping nearby. Location near to Mall and 24 Parking nearby. The Bar had good hours we met family there. Very easy Hotel location and Staff were accommodating. We arrived a little earlier than expected and was provided an earlier check in. Room was very quiet spacious well thought out. Bath was nice. Bar and Toiletries good. Lovely to see some options for people with allergies sensitivities or vegan lifestyle provided here. Room was very comfortable and well lit although natural light would have been a lot better. Does the building have Solar. We felt guilty using so much lighting. Overall well done team. We loved the music playing in the foyer. Coffee was nice at the Bar too. I was charged a credit card fee despite using a mastercard debit card. The colour grey all over the entire building was too much grey for us. Some brighter colours would be nice to see. People watching you from the gym while you swam felt a bit creepy. Great for parents maybe. The gym provided towels and water and wipes too well done. The steam room was not clean though. I m sure there was fat grease on the floor on its way to the drain. The showers were not clean and the drain being exposed was very off putting. Not expected in a five star Hotel. The lift was a little annoying to use with the swipe card good security though. Our windows were very dirty expected given the drought though. Good blinds hid the awful view of the roof though.
Very happy with everything. Would recommend it to anyone. Very close to the shops and if u park in the top levels of the U park u can make sure ur cars ok.
All the staff were wonderful will recommend to anyone. Breakfast was delicious so was dinner. The park across the way was beautiful. We loved it ca n’t wait to go back.
